upload_request.title: Upload permission
upload_request.description: To upload a file in DatoCMS, first you need to obtain an upload permission through this API endpoint. The response will contain the S3 URL where you will be able to upload the file with a direct PUT request.

id.description: The S3 path where the file will be stored

url.description: The URL to use to upload the file with a direct PUT request

page[offset].description: index of first record to fetch

version.description: whether you want the currently published versions of your records, or the latest available

links.title: References
links.description: List all the records of a model that link to a specific record

version.description: whether you want the currently published version of the record, or the latest available

item.title: Record
item.description: DatoCMS stores the individual pieces of content you create from a Model as Records, which are much like table rows in a database. For backward-compatibility reasons, the API refers to records as "items".

attributes.description: The JSON data associated to the record

is_valid.description: Whether the current item is valid or not

creator.description: The entity (account/editor/access token) who created the record

attributes.description: The JSON data associated to the item_version

site.title: Site
site.description: A site represents a specific DatoCMS administrative area

internal_domain.description: DatoCMS internal domain for the administrative area

items_count.description: Number of items present in the site

no_index.description: Whether the website needs to be indexed by search engines or not

favicon.description: The upload id for the favicon

theme_hue.description: Specifies the hue to use primary color in Site backend

last_data_change_at.description: Specifies the last time when a change of data occurred

last_dump_at.description: Specifies the last time an integration plugin called the API

deployable.description: Specifies whether all the deploy informations are correctly setup or not

require_2fa.description: Specifies whether all users of this site need to authenticate using two-factor authentication

theme.description: Specifies the theme to use in administrative area

site_name.description: Site name, used in social sharing

twitter_card.description: Determines how a Twitter link preview is shown

data.description: The list of site menu items
The list of site item types

menu_item.title: Menu Item
menu_item.description: In DatoCMS you can organize the different Models present in your administrative area reordering and grouping them, so that their purpose will be more clear to the final editor.

label.description: The label of the menu item

item_type.description: item type associated with the menu item

deploy_event.title: Deploy activity
deploy_event.description: Represents an event occurred during the deploy process of your administrative area.

item_type.title: Model
item_type.description: The way you define the kind of content you can edit inside your administrative area passes through the concept of Models, which are much like database tables. For backward-compatibility reasons, the API refers to models as "item types".

menu_item.description: The menu item instance related to this item type

singleton_item.description: The item instance related to this item type

fields.description: The list of item type fields

title_field.description: The field to use as display title

ordering_field.description: The field upon which the collection is sorted

field.title: Field
field.description: Each Model consists of a set of fields. Using the database metaphore, fields are like table columns, and when creating them you need to specify their type ("string", "image", "float", etc.) and any required validation.

localized.description: Whether the field needs to be multilanguage or not

hint.example: This field will be used as post title

user.title: Editor
user.description: A DatoCMS administrative area can be accessed by multiple people. Every editor is linked to a specific Role, which describes what actions it will be able to perform once logged in.

search_result.title: Search result
search_result.description: DatoCMS Site Search is a way to deliver tailored search results to your site visitors. This is the endpoint you can use to query for results.

body_excerpt.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed eiusmod

session.title: Session
session.description: A session is required to access to read-and-write API endpoints

id.description: JSON web token for the session

user.description: The user associated with the session

role.title: Role
role.description: A Role represents a specific set of actions an editor (or an API token) can perform on your administrative area.

can_edit_favicon.description: Can users edit the site favicon/global SEO settings?

can_edit_site.description: Can users edit the site settings?

deployment_environments.description: Environments on which this role can deploy

access_token.title: API token
access_token.description: An API token allows access to our API. It is linked to a Role, which describes what actions can be performed.

page[offset].description: Index of first record to fetch

upload.title: Upload
upload.description: Every file you upload to DatoCMS will be retrievable from this endpoint.

plugin.title: Plugin
plugin.description: Plugins enable developers to replace DatoCMS field components with HTML5 applications so the editing experiences of the DatoCMS web app can be customized.

description.description: A textual description for the plugin
description.example: A simple field editor that allows a nicer editing rating experience

field_types.description: On which types of field this plugin can be used

parameters.description: Global parameters which are set on on a project level. Values apply globally to every instance of an plugin within the project.

instance.label: Allow half stars ratings?
instance.hint: If enabled, rate using whole stars, if enabled, it doesn't use half-steps

active.description: Whether this plan is active or legacy

custom_domain.description: Whether custom domain can be enabled or not

users.description: Number of users that can be invited

version_history.description: Whether version history can be enabled or not

otp.description: Whether two-factor authentication can be enabled or not

scheduled_publication.title: Scheduled publication
scheduled_publication.description: You can create scheduled publication to publish records in the future

publication_scheduled_at.description: The future date for the publication

webhook.title: Webhook
webhook.description: A webhook allows to make requests following certain Dato events. It is linked to a Role, which describes what actions can be performed.

headers.description: Additional headers that will be sent

events.description: All the events you will be notified for

links.title: Resend webhook
links.description: Resends the webhook with the same parameters

webhook_call.title: Webhook call
webhook_call.description: Represents a log entry in the webhooks activity list.

event_type.description: The event that triggers the webhook call

request_url.description: The url that the webhook called

webhook.description: The webhook which has been called

links.title: Index
links.description: List all deployment environments for a site

deployment_environment.title: Deployment environment
deployment_environment.description: Configuration for different deployment environments. You can have different staging and production environments in order to test your site before final deploy

item_type_filter.title: Model filter
item_type_filter.description: In DatoCMS you can create filters to help you (and other editors) quickly search for records

shared.description: Whether it's a shared filter or not
